df-limc
blocks.content: Define the set of limits of a complex function at a point. Under normal circumstances, this will be a singleton or empty, depending on whether the limit exists. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-limc(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(climc, cmpo(s0, s1, co(cc, cpm, cc), cc, cab(s2, wsbc(s3, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), wcel(cmpt(s4, cun(cdm(cv(s0)), csn(cv(s1))), cif(cv(s2), cfv(cv(s0), cv(s4)), wceq(cv(s4), cv(s1)))), cfv(co(co(cv(s3), crest, cun(cdm(cv(s0)), csn(cv(s1)))), ccnp, cv(s3)), cv(s1)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-limc(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ limCC =(s0 ‚àà(‚ÑÇ[p‚Ü¶]‚ÑÇ), s1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ ‚Ü¶ { s2 |[(TopOpen ` CCfld)/ s3](s4 ‚àà(dom(s0)‚ãÉ { s1 })‚Ü¶ if(s4 = s1, s2,(s0 ` s4)))‚àà(((s3[|`t](dom(s0)‚ãÉ { s1 }))[CnP]s3)` s1)})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
}

blocks.name: df-dv
blocks.content: Define the derivative operator. This acts on functions to produce a function that is defined where the original function is differentiable, with value the derivative of the function at these points. The set ` s ` here is the ambient topological space under which we are evaluating the continuity of the difference quotient. Although the definition is valid for any subset of ` CC ` and is well-behaved when ` s ` contains no isolated points, we will restrict our attention to the cases ` s = RR ` or ` s = CC ` for the majority of the development, these corresponding respectively to real and complex differentiation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Aug-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-dv(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cdv, cmpo(s0, s1, cpw(cc), co(cc, cpm, cv(s0)), ciun(s2, cfv(cfv(cnt, co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, cv(s0))), cdm(cv(s1))), cxp(csn(cv(s2)), co(cmpt(s3, cdif(cdm(cv(s1)), csn(cv(s2))), co(co(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)), cmin, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cdiv, co(cv(s3), cmin, cv(s2)))), climc, cv(s2))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-dv(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ _D =(s0 ‚àà P(‚ÑÇ), s1 ‚àà(‚ÑÇ[p‚Ü¶]s0)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÉ(s2 ‚àà((int `((TopOpen ` CCfld)[|`t]s0))` dom(s1)),({ s2 } √ó((s3 ‚àà(dom(s1)\ { s2 })‚Ü¶(((s1 ` s3)[-](s1 ` s2))[√∑](s3[-]s2)))[limCC]s2))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
}

blocks.name: df-dvn
blocks.content: Define the ` n ` -th derivative operator on functions on the complex numbers. This just iterates the derivative operation according to the last argument. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: df-cpn
blocks.content: Define the set of ` n ` -times continuously differentiable functions. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Nov-2014.)

blocks.name: reldv

blocks.name: limcvallem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ ellimc . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)

thm limcvallem(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wi(wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2)), wcel(c6, cc)))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c5, crest, cun(c1, csn(c2))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s0, cun(c1, csn(c2)), cif(c6, cfv(c0, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wi(wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2)), wcel(c6, cc))), diffsc(s0, c0))

  rspcdva(s0, c2, cun(c1, csn(c2)), wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))), wcel(c6, cc), wcel(cif(c6, cfv(c0, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2)), cc))
  eleq1d(cif(c6, cfv(c0, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2)), cc, c6, wceq(cv(s0), c2))
  iftrue(c6, cfv(c0, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2))
  sylibr(wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))), wral(s0, cun(c1, csn(c2)), wcel(cif(c6, cfv(c0, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2)), cc)), wf(c3, cun(c1, csn(c2)), cc))
  syl3anc(wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))), wf(c3, cun(c1, csn(c2)), cc), wcel(c4, cfv(ctopon, cun(c1, csn(c2)))), wcel(c5, cfv(ctopon, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2)))
  syl5eqel(c4, cfv(ctopon, cun(c1, csn(c2))), co(c5, crest, cun(c1, csn(c2))), wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))))
  sylancr(wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))), wcel(co(c5, crest, cun(c1, csn(c2))), cfv(ctopon, cun(c1, csn(c2)))), wcel(c5, cfv(ctopon, cc)), wss(cun(c1, csn(c2)), cc))
  unssd(c1, csn(c2), cc, wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))))
  simpl2(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2)))
  snssd(c2, cc, wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))))
  resttopon(c5, cc, cun(c1, csn(c2)))
  a1i(wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))), wcel(c5, cfv(ctopon, cc)))

  cnpf2(c4, cun(c1, csn(c2)), c5, cc, c3, c2)
  fmpt(s0, cun(c1, csn(c2)), cif(c6, cfv(c0, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2)), cc, c3)
  mpbiri(wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))), wcel(c2, cun(c1, csn(c2))), wss(csn(c2), cun(c1, csn(c2))))
  ssun2(csn(c2), c1)
  syl(wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))), wb(wcel(c2, cun(c1, csn(c2))), wss(csn(c2), cun(c1, csn(c2)))), wcel(c2, cc))
  simpl3(wf(c0, c1, cc), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2)))
  snssg(c2, cc, cun(c1, csn(c2)))

  diff.csn.s(s0, c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c6, cc)
  diff.cc.s(s0)
}

thm limcvallem(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ‚ä¢ (((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚Üí(c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)‚Üí c6 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(c5[|`t](c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }))
  ‚ä£ c5 =(TopOpen ` CCfld)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(s0 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })‚Ü¶ if(s0 = c2, c6,(c0 ` s0)))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c6)
} = {
  a1ii((((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚Üí(c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)‚Üí c6 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)), d(s0, c0))
  a1ii((((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚Üí(c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)‚Üí c6 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)), d(s0, c5))
  ex(((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2), c6 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  rspcdva(s0, c2, (c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }), (((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)), c6 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ, if(s0 = c2, c6,(c0 ` s0))‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  eleq1d(if(s0 = c2, c6,(c0 ` s0)), cc, c6, s0 = c2)
  iftrue(c6, (c0 ` s0), s0 = c2)
  sylibr((((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }), if(s0 = c2, c6,(c0 ` s0))‚àà ‚ÑÇ), (c3 :(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })‚Üí ‚ÑÇ))
  syl3anc((((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)), (c3 :(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })‚Üí ‚ÑÇ), c4 ‚àà(TopOn `(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })), c5 ‚àà(TopOn ` ‚ÑÇ), c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2))
  syl5eqel(c4, (TopOn `(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })), (c5[|`t](c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })), (((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)))
  sylancr((((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)), (c5[|`t](c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }))‚àà(TopOn `(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })), c5 ‚àà(TopOn ` ‚ÑÇ), (c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)
  unssd(c1, { c2 }, cc, (((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)))
  simpl2((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ), c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ, c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ, c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2))
  snssd(c2, cc, (((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)))
  resttopon(c5, cc, (c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }))
  a1i((((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)), c5 ‚àà(TopOn ` ‚ÑÇ))
  cnfldtopon(c5)
  simpr(((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2))
  cnpf2(c4, (c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }), c5, cc, c3, c2)
  fmpt(s0, (c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }), if(s0 = c2, c6,(c0 ` s0)), cc, c3)
  mpbiri((((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)), c2 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }), { c2 } ‚äÜ(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }))
  ssun2({ c2 }, c1)
  syl((((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)‚àß c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2)), (c2 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })‚Üî { c2 } ‚äÜ(c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 })), c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  simpl3((c0 : c1 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ), c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ, c2 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ, c3 ‚àà((c4[CnP]c5)` c2))
  snssg(c2, cc, (c1 ‚ãÉ { c2 }))
  diff.cun.s(s0, c1, { c2 })
  diff.csn.s(s0, c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c6, cc)
  diff.cc.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: ellimc
blocks.content: Value of the limit predicate. ` C ` is the limit of the function ` F ` at ` B ` if the function ` G ` , formed by adding ` B ` to the domain of ` F ` and setting it to ` C ` , is continuous at ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm ellimc(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, climc, c2)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c5, crest, cun(c6, csn(c2))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s0, cun(c6, csn(c2)), cif(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c6, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c6, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cc))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {
  bitrd(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, climc, c2)), wcel(c3, cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2)), wcel(c0, cab(hs0, wcel(cmpt(s0, cun(c6, csn(c2)), cif(cv(hs0), cfv(c1, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2))), cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2)))))
  eleq2d(c0, co(c1, climc, c2), cab(hs0, wcel(cmpt(s0, cun(c6, csn(c2)), cif(cv(hs0), cfv(c1, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2))), cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2))), w0)
  simpld(w0, wceq(co(c1, climc, c2), cab(hs0, wcel(cmpt(s0, cun(c6, csn(c2)), cif(cv(hs0), cfv(c1, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), c2))), cfv(co(c4, ccnp, c5), c2)))), wss(co(c1, climc, c2), cc))

blocks.name: limcdif
blocks.content: It suffices to consider functions which are not defined at ` B ` to define the limit of a function. In particular, the value of the original function ` F ` at ` B ` does not affect the limit of ` F ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)

thm limcdif(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {

  simp3d(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, climc, c1))), wcel(c1, cc), wf(c0, cdm(c0), cc), wss(cdm(c0), cc))
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, climc, c1)), w3a(wf(c0, cdm(c0), cc), wss(cdm(c0), cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  limcrcl(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  ex(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1)), wa(wss(c2, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  jca(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1))), wss(c2, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  unssad(c2, cc, csn(c1), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1))))
  syl5eqssr(cun(c2, csn(c1)), cc, cun(cdif(c2, csn(c1)), csn(c1)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1))))
  unssd(cdif(c2, csn(c1)), csn(c1), cc, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1))))
  eqsstr3d(cdif(c2, csn(c1)), cc, cdm(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1)), wceq(cdm(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cdif(c2, csn(c1))))
  fdmd(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), cdif(c2, csn(c1)), cc, w0)
  simp2d(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1))), wss(cdm(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cc), wf(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), cdm(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  snssd(c1, cc, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1))))
  simp3d(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), climc, c1))), wcel(c1, cc), wf(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1))), cdm(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cc), wss(cdm(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cc))

blocks.name: limcnlp
blocks.content: If ` B ` is not a limit point of the domain of the function ` F ` , then every point is a limit of ` F ` at ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm limcnlp(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, climc, c1), cc))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c2, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(clp, c3), c2))))
} = {
  eqrdv(hs0, co(c0, climc, c1), cc, w0)
  bitr4d(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, climc, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wral(hs1, c3, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs2, c3, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1))))))))
  ellimc2(hs1, hs2, cv(hs0), c0, c1, c3, c2, w0)
  pm4.71d(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wral(hs1, c3, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs2, c3, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1)))))))
  ex(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wral(hs1, c3, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs2, c3, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1)))))))
  ralrimivw(hs1, c3, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc)), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs2, c3, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1))))))
  a1d(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs2, c3, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1)))))
  syl12anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc)), wrex(hs2, c3, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1)))), wcel(cdif(cc, cfv(cfv(ccl, c3), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), c3), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, cfv(cfv(ccl, c3), cdif(c2, csn(c1))))), wss(cima(c0, cin(cdif(cc, cfv(cfv(ccl, c3), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1)))
  syl(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc)), wcel(cdif(cc, cfv(cfv(ccl, c3), cdif(c2, csn(c1)))), c3), wcel(cfv(cfv(ccl, c3), cdif(c2, csn(c1))), cfv(ccld, c3)))
  sylancr(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc)), wcel(cfv(cfv(ccl, c3), cdif(c2, csn(c1))), cfv(ccld, c3)), wcel(c3, ctop), wss(cdif(c2, csn(c1)), cc))
  clscld(c3, cdif(c2, csn(c1)), cc)
  cldopn(cfv(cfv(ccl, c3), cdif(c2, csn(c1))), c3, cc)

blocks.name: limcflflem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ limcflf . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm limcflflem(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cfil, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c3, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c3, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cfv(cfv(clp, c5), c3)))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wceq(c1, cdif(c3, csn(c4)))
  -| wceq(c0, co(cfv(cfv(cnei, c5), csn(c4)), crest, c1))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cfil, c1))), wi(w0, wf(c2, c3, cc)))
  syl5eqel(c0, cfv(cfil, c1), co(cfv(cfv(cnei, c5), csn(c4)), crest, c1), w0)
  mpbid(w0, wcel(co(cfv(cfv(cnei, c5), csn(c4)), crest, c1), cfv(cfil, c1)), wcel(c4, cfv(cfv(ccl, c5), c1)))
  syl6eleqr(c4, cfv(cfv(ccl, c5), c1), cfv(cfv(ccl, c5), cdif(c3, csn(c4))), w0)
  mpbid(w0, wcel(c4, cfv(cfv(ccl, c5), cdif(c3, csn(c4)))), wcel(c4, cfv(cfv(clp, c5), c3)))
  sylancr(w0, wb(wcel(c4, cfv(cfv(clp, c5), c3)), wcel(c4, cfv(cfv(ccl, c5), cdif(c3, csn(c4))))), wcel(c5, ctop), wss(c3, cc))
  islp(c5, c3, cc, c4)
  fveq2i(cfv(ccl, c5), c1, cdif(c3, csn(c4)))
  mp3an2i(w0, wb(wcel(c4, cfv(cfv(ccl, c5), c1)), wcel(co(cfv(cfv(cnei, c5), csn(c4)), crest, c1), cfv(cfil, c1))), wcel(c5, cfv(ctopon, cc)), wss(c1, cc), wcel(c4, cc))
  syl5ss(c1, cc, c3, w0)
  eqsstri(c1, c3, cdif(c3, csn(c4)))
  difss(c3, csn(c4))
  sseldd(c4, cc, cfv(cfv(clp, c5), c3), w0)
  sylancr(w0, wss(cfv(cfv(clp, c5), c3), cc), wcel(c5, ctop), wss(c3, cc))
  cnfldtop(c5)
  lpss(c5, c3, cc)
  toponunii(cc, c5)
  cnfldtopon(c5)
  trnei(c5, cc, c1, c4)
}

thm limcflflem(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(Fil ` c1))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c2 : c3 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c4 ‚àà((limPt ` c5)` c3))
  ‚ä£ c5 =(TopOpen ` CCfld)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(c3 \ { c4 })
  ‚ä£ c0 =(((nei ` c5)` { c4 })[|`t]c1)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(Fil ` c1)), (w0 ‚Üí(c2 : c3 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)))
  syl5eqel(c0, (Fil ` c1), (((nei ` c5)` { c4 })[|`t]c1), w0)
  mpbid(w0, (((nei ` c5)` { c4 })[|`t]c1)‚àà(Fil ` c1), c4 ‚àà((cls ` c5)` c1))
  syl6eleqr(c4, ((cls ` c5)` c1), ((cls ` c5)`(c3 \ { c4 })), w0)
  mpbid(w0, c4 ‚àà((cls ` c5)`(c3 \ { c4 })), c4 ‚àà((limPt ` c5)` c3))
  sylancr(w0, (c4 ‚àà((limPt ` c5)` c3)‚Üî c4 ‚àà((cls ` c5)`(c3 \ { c4 }))), c5 ‚àà Top, c3 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)
  islp(c5, c3, cc, c4)
  fveq2i((cls ` c5), c1, (c3 \ { c4 }))
  mp3an2i(w0, (c4 ‚àà((cls ` c5)` c1)‚Üî(((nei ` c5)` { c4 })[|`t]c1)‚àà(Fil ` c1)), c5 ‚àà(TopOn ` ‚ÑÇ), c1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ, c4 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  syl5ss(c1, cc, c3, w0)
  eqsstri(c1, c3, (c3 \ { c4 }))
  difss(c3, { c4 })
  sseldd(c4, cc, ((limPt ` c5)` c3), w0)
  sylancr(w0, ((limPt ` c5)` c3)‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ, c5 ‚àà Top, c3 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)
  cnfldtop(c5)
  lpss(c5, c3, cc)
  toponunii(cc, c5)
  cnfldtopon(c5)
  trnei(c5, cc, c1, c4)
}

blocks.name: limcflf
blocks.content: The limit operator can be expressed as a filter limit, from the filter of neighborhoods of ` B ` restricted to ` A \ { B } ` , to the topology of the complex numbers. (If ` B ` is not a limit point of ` A ` , then it is still formally a filter limit, but the neighborhood filter is not a proper filter in this case.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wceq(c4, cdif(c5, csn(c1)))
  -| wceq(c3, co(cfv(cfv(cnei, c2), csn(c1)), crest, c4))

  pm5.32da(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wral(hs1, c2, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs2, c2, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c5, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1)))))), wral(hs1, c2, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs3, c3, wss(cima(cres(c0, c4), cv(hs3)), cv(hs1))))))
  ralbidva(hs1, c2, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc)), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs2, c2, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c5, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1))))), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wrex(hs3, c3, wss(cima(cres(c0, c4), cv(hs3)), cv(hs1)))))

  anassrs(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc)), wcel(cv(hs1), c2), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wb(wrex(hs2, c2, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c5, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1)))), wrex(hs3, c3, wss(cima(cres(c0, c4), cv(hs3)), cv(hs1)))))
  3bitr4rd(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), c2), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), wrex(hs2, c2, wa(wcel(c1, cv(hs2)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs2), cdif(c5, csn(c1)))), cv(hs1)))), wrex(hs3, c3, wss(cima(cres(c0, c4), cv(hs3)), cv(hs1))), wrex(hs3, crn(cmpt(hs4, cfv(cfv(cnei, c2), csn(c1)), cin(cv(hs4), c4))), wss(cima(cres(c0, c4), cv(hs3)), cv(hs1))), wrex(hs4, cfv(cfv(cnei, c2), csn(c1)), wss(cima(c0, cin(cv(hs4), c4)), cv(hs1))))

blocks.name: limcmo
blocks.content: If ` B ` is a limit point of the domain of the function ` F ` , then there is at most one limit value of ` F ` at ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: cnplimc
blocks.content: A function is continuous at ` B ` iff its limit at ` B ` equals the value of the function there. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: cnlimc
blocks.content: ` F ` is a continuous function iff the limit of the function at each point equals the value of the function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnlimc(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, cc), wb(wcel(c1, co(c0, ccncf, cc)), wa(wf(c1, c0, cc), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c1, climc, cv(s0)))))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  3bitrd(wss(c0, cc), wcel(c1, co(c0, ccncf, cc)), wa(wf(c1, c0, cc), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), co(c1, climc, cv(s0))))), wcel(c1, co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))), wa(wf(c1, c0, cc), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, cfv(co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), ccnp, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), cv(s0))))))
  eleq2d(c1, co(c0, ccncf, cc), co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), wss(c0, cc))
  mpan2(wss(c0, cc), wceq(co(c0, ccncf, cc), co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c0), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))), wss(cc, cc))
  ssid(cc)

blocks.content: The image of a convergent sequence under a continuous map is convergent to the image of the original point. Binary operation version. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: limcco
blocks.content: Composition of two limits. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm limcco(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(cmpt(s0, c1, c2), climc, c3)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wne(c4, c5))), wcel(c4, c6))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c6)), wcel(c7, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, co(cmpt(s0, c1, c4), climc, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(cmpt(s1, c6, c7), climc, c5)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), c4), wceq(c7, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wceq(c4, c5))), wceq(c2, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  3eltr3d(c0, co(cmpt(s0, c1, c2), climc, c3), cfv(cmpt(s1, cun(c6, csn(c5)), cif(c0, c7, wceq(cv(s1), c5))), c5), co(ccom(cmpt(s1, cun(c6, csn(c5)), cif(c0, c7, wceq(cv(s1), c5))), cmpt(s0, c1, c4)), climc, c3), w0)
  limccnp(cmpt(s1, cun(c6, csn(c5)), cif(c0, c7, wceq(cv(s1), c5))), c5, cmpt(s0, c1, c4), c3, c1, cun(c6, csn(c5)), cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, cun(c6, csn(c5))), w0)
  fmpttd(s0, c1, c4, cun(c6, csn(c5)), w0)
  unssd(c6, csn(c5), cc, w0)
  snssd(c5, cc, w0)
  mpbid(w0, wcel(cmpt(s1, cun(c6, csn(c5)), cif(c0, c7, wceq(cv(s1), c5))), cfv(co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, cun(c6, csn(c5))), ccnp, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), c5)), wcel(c0, co(cmpt(s1, c6, c7), climc, c5)))
  limcmpt(s1, c0, c6, c7, c5, co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, cun(c6, csn(c5))), cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), w0)
  eqsstr3d(c6, cc, cdm(cmpt(s1, c6, c7)), w0)
  dmmptd(s1, cmpt(s1, c6, c7), c6, c7, cc, w0)
  eqid(cmpt(s1, c6, c7))
  simp2d(w0, wss(cdm(cmpt(s1, c6, c7)), cc), wf(cmpt(s1, c6, c7), cdm(cmpt(s1, c6, c7)), cc), wcel(c5, cc))
  syl(w0, w3a(wf(cmpt(s1, c6, c7), cdm(cmpt(s1, c6, c7)), cc), wss(cdm(cmpt(s1, c6, c7)), cc), wcel(c5, cc)), wcel(c0, co(cmpt(s1, c6, c7), climc, c5)))
  limcrcl(c0, cmpt(s1, c6, c7), c5)

blocks.name: limciun
blocks.content: A point is a limit of ` F ` on the finite union ` U_ x e. A B ( x ) ` iff it is the limit of the restriction of ` F ` to each ` B ( x ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: limcun
blocks.content: A point is a limit of ` F ` on ` A u. B ` iff it is the limit of the restriction of ` F ` to ` A ` and to ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm limcun(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, climc, c1), cin(co(cres(c0, c2), climc, c1), co(cres(c0, c3), climc, c1))))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c2, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c3, cc))

thm limcun(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0[limCC]c1)=(((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚ãÇ((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1)))

  eqrdv(hs0, (c0[limCC]c1), (((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚ãÇ((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1)), w0)

  limcrcl(hs0, c0, c1)
  a1i(w0, (hs0 ‚àà(((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚ãÇ((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1))‚Üí c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ))
  syl(hs0 ‚àà(((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚ãÇ((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1)), c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ, hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1))
  elinel1(hs0, ((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1), ((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1))
  simp3d(hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1), c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ, ((c0 |` c2): dom((c0 |` c2))‚Üí ‚ÑÇ), dom((c0 |` c2))‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)
  limcrcl(hs0, (c0 |` c2), c1)
  ex(w0, c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ, (hs0 ‚àà(c0[limCC]c1)‚Üî hs0 ‚àà(((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚ãÇ((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1))))
  bitrd((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), hs0 ‚àà(c0[limCC]c1), hs0 ‚àà(((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚ãÇ((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1)), hs0 ‚àà(‚ÑÇ ‚ãÇ ‚ãÇ(hs1 ‚àà { c2, c3 },((c0 |` hs1)[limCC]c1))))
  eleq2d(hs0, (c0[limCC]c1), (‚ÑÇ ‚ãÇ ‚ãÇ(hs1 ‚àà { c2, c3 },((c0 |` hs1)[limCC]c1))), (w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ))
  limciun(hs1, c0, c1, { c2, c3 }, hs1, (w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ))
  a1i((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), { c2, c3 } ‚àà Fin)
  prfi(c2, c3)
  mpbir2and((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà { c2, c3 }, hs1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ), c2 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ, c3 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)
  syl2anc((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), (‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà { c2, c3 }, hs1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)‚Üî(c2 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚àß c3 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)), c2 ‚àà ùïå, c3 ‚àà ùïå)
  ralprg(hs1, c2, universe, c3, universe, hs1 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ, c2 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ, c3 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)
  sseq1(hs1, c2, cc)
  sseq1(hs1, c3, cc)
  mpbird((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), (c0 : ‚ãÉ(hs1 ‚àà { c2, c3 }, hs1)‚Üí ‚ÑÇ), (c0 :(c2 ‚ãÉ c3)‚Üí ‚ÑÇ))

  syl5eqr(‚ãÉ(hs1 ‚àà { c2, c3 }, hs1), (c2 ‚ãÉ c3), ‚ãÉ { c2, c3 }, (w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ))

  syl6bbr((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), (hs0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ ‚àß ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà { c2, c3 }, hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` hs1)[limCC]c1))), (hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚àß hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1)), (hs0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ ‚àß(hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚àß hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1))))
  anbi2d((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), hs0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ, ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà { c2, c3 }, hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` hs1)[limCC]c1)), (hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚àß hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1)))
  syl2anc((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), (‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà { c2, c3 }, hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` hs1)[limCC]c1))‚Üî(hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚àß hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1))), c2 ‚àà ùïå, c3 ‚àà ùïå)
  syl((w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), c2 ‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ)

  pm4.71ri((hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1)‚àß hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1)), hs0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  adantr(hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1), hs0 ‚àà((c0 |` c3)[limCC]c1), hs0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  sseli(hs0, ((c0 |` c2)[limCC]c1), cc)

thm dvlem(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(c0, cdif(c1, csn(c2)))), wcel(co(co(cfv(c3, c0), cmin, cfv(c3, c2)), cdiv, co(c0, cmin, c2)), cc))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c3, c1, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c1))
} = {
  sylan2b(w0, wcel(c0, cdif(c1, csn(c2))), wcel(co(co(cfv(c3, c0), cmin, cfv(c3, c2)), cdiv, co(c0, cmin, c2)), cc), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2)))
  eldifsn(c0, c1, c2)
  divcld(co(cfv(c3, c0), cmin, cfv(c3, c2)), co(c0, cmin, c2), wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))))
  subcld(cfv(c3, c0), cfv(c3, c2), wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))))
  ffvelrnd(c3, c0, cc, c1, wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))))
  ffvelrnd(c3, c2, cc, c1, wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2)), wf(c3, c1, cc))
  subcld(c0, c2, wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))))
  subne0d(c0, c2, wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))))
  sseldd(c0, cc, c1, wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))))
  simprl(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))
  sseldd(c2, cc, c1, wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2)), wss(c1, cc))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2)), wcel(c2, c1))
  simprr(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, c2))
}

  ‚ä¢ ((w0 ‚àß c0 ‚àà(c1 \ { c2 }))‚Üí(((c3 ` c0)[-](c3 ` c2))[√∑](c0[-]c2))‚àà ‚ÑÇ)

blocks.name: eldv
blocks.content: The differentiable predicate. A function ` F ` is differentiable at ` B ` with derivative ` C ` iff ` F ` is defined in a neighborhood of ` B ` and the difference quotient has limit ` C ` at ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm eldv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, co(c1, cdv, c2), c3), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfv(cnt, c4), c5)), wcel(c3, co(c6, climc, c0)))))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c7, crest, c1))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wceq(c6, cmpt(s0, cdif(c5, csn(c0)), co(co(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cmin, cfv(c2, c0)), cdiv, co(cv(s0), cmin, c0))))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c5, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c5, c1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
} = {

blocks.name: recnperf

thm recnperf(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(co(c1, crest, c0), cperf))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(co(c1, crest, c0), cperf), wo(wceq(c0, cr), wceq(c0, cc)))
  elpri(c0, cr, cc)
  jaoi(wceq(c0, cr), wceq(c0, cc), wcel(co(c1, crest, c0), cperf))
  syl6eqel(co(c1, crest, c0), cperf, co(c1, crest, cr), wceq(c0, cr))
  oveq2(c0, cr, c1, crest)
  reperf(c1)
  syl6eqel(co(c1, crest, c0), cperf, co(c1, crest, cc), wceq(c0, cc))
  oveq2(c0, cc, c1, crest)
  eqeltri(co(c1, crest, cc), cperf, c1)
  ax-mp(wceq(co(c1, crest, cc), c1), wcel(c1, cfv(ctopon, cc)))
  restid(c1, cfv(ctopon, cc), cc)
  toponunii(cc, c1)
  cnfldtopon(c1)
  cnperf(c1)
}

blocks.name: dvres
blocks.content: Restriction of a derivative. Note that our definition of derivative ~ df-dv would still make sense if we demanded that ` x ` be an element of the domain instead of an interior point of the domain, but then it is possible for a non-differentiable function to have two different derivatives at a single point ` x ` when restricted to different subsets containing ` x ` ; a classic example is the absolute value function restricted to ` [ 0 , +oo ) ` and ` ( -oo , 0 ] ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: dvres2
blocks.content: Restriction of the base set of a derivative. The primary application of this theorem says that if a function is complex-differentiable then it is also real-differentiable. Unlike ~ dvres , there is no simple reverse relation relating real-differentiable functions to complex differentiability, and indeed there are functions like ` Re ( x ) ` which are everywhere real-differentiable but nowhere complex-differentiable.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2015.)

thm dvconst(class c0) {

  oveq1d(co(cfv(cxp(cc, csn(c0)), cv(hs1)), cmin, cfv(cxp(cc, csn(c0)), cv(hs0))), cdiv, co(cv(hs1), cmin, cv(hs0)), nat0, wa(wcel(c0, cc), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))))
  eqtrd(co(cfv(cxp(cc, csn(c0)), cv(hs1)), cmin, cfv(cxp(cc, csn(c0)), cv(hs0))), nat0, co(c0, cmin, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cc), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))))
  oveq12d(cfv(cxp(cc, csn(c0)), cv(hs1)), cmin, cfv(cxp(cc, csn(c0)), cv(hs0)), c0, c0, wa(wcel(c0, cc), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))))
  syldan(wcel(c0, cc), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))), wceq(cfv(cxp(cc, csn(c0)), cv(hs1)), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), cc))
  fvconst2g(c0, cc, cv(hs1), cc)
  3ad2antr1(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wceq(cfv(cxp(cc, csn(c0)), cv(hs0)), c0))
  fvconst2g(c0, cc, cv(hs0), cc)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cc), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))), wceq(co(c0, cmin, c0), nat0))
  subid(c0)
  div0d(co(cv(hs1), cmin, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))))
  subcld(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), wa(wcel(c0, cc), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))))
  subne0d(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), wa(wcel(c0, cc), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))))
  simpr2(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))
  simpr1(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))
  simpr3(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))

  diff.hs1.c(cxp(cc, csn(c0)))

blocks.name: dvid
blocks.content: Derivative of the identity function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm dvid() {
  |- wceq(co(cc, cdv, cres(cid, cc)), cxp(cc, csn(nat1)))
} = {
  mptru(wceq(co(cc, cdv, cres(cid, cc)), cxp(cc, csn(nat1))))
  dvidlem(hs0, hs1, cres(cid, cc), nat1, wtru)
  mp1i(wtru, wf(cres(cid, cc), cc, cc), wf1o(cres(cid, cc), cc, cc))
  f1oi(cc)
  f1of(cres(cid, cc), cc, cc)
  adantl(wtru, w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))), wceq(co(co(cfv(cres(cid, cc), cv(hs1)), cmin, cfv(cres(cid, cc), cv(hs0))), cdiv, co(cv(hs1), cmin, cv(hs0))), nat1))
  diveq1bd(co(cfv(cres(cid, cc), cv(hs1)), cmin, cfv(cres(cid, cc), cv(hs0))), co(cv(hs1), cmin, cv(hs0)), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))))
  subcld(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))))
  subne0d(cv(hs1), cv(hs0), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))))
  simp2(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))
  simp1(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))
  simp3(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))
  3adant3(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wne(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wceq(co(cfv(cres(cid, cc), cv(hs1)), cmin, cfv(cres(cid, cc), cv(hs0))), co(cv(hs1), cmin, cv(hs0))))
  oveqan12rd(cfv(cres(cid, cc), cv(hs1)), cmin, cfv(cres(cid, cc), cv(hs0)), cv(hs1), cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(cv(hs1), cc))
  fvresi(cv(hs1), cc)
  fvresi(cv(hs0), cc)
  ax-1cn()
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cres(cid, cc))
  diff.hs0.c(nat1)
  diff.hs1.c(cres(cid, cc))
  diff.hs1.c(nat1)
  diff.hs0.w(wtru)
  diff.hs1.w(wtru)
}

blocks.name: dvcnp
blocks.content: The difference quotient is continuous at ` B ` when the original function is differentiable at ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm dvcnp(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wf(c1, c2, cc), wss(c2, c0)), wcel(c3, cdm(co(c0, cdv, c1)))), wcel(c4, cfv(co(c5, ccnp, c6), c3)))
  -| wceq(c5, co(c6, crest, c2))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wceq(c4, cmpt(s0, c2, cif(cfv(co(c0, cdv, c1), c3), co(co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cmin, cfv(c1, c3)), cdiv, co(cv(s0), cmin, c3)), wceq(cv(s0), c3))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)

thm dvcn(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  sylancl(wa(w3a(wss(c0, cc), wf(c1, c2, cc), wss(c2, c0)), wceq(cdm(co(c0, cdv, c1)), c2)), wb(wcel(c1, co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c2), ccn, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))), wa(wf(c1, c2, cc), wral(hs0, c2, wcel(c1, cfv(co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c2), ccnp, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld)), cv(hs0)))))), wcel(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c2), cfv(ctopon, c2)), wcel(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cfv(ctopon, cc)))

} = {

blocks.name: dvnf
blocks.content: The N-times derivative is a function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 16-Nov-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm dvnf(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0)), wcel(c2, cn0)), wf(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2), cdm(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2)), cc))
} = {
  simpld(w3a(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0)), wcel(c2, cn0)), wf(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2), cdm(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2)), cc), wss(cdm(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2)), cdm(c1)))
  mpbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0)), wcel(c2, cn0)), wa(wf(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2), cdm(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2)), cc), wss(cdm(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2)), cdm(c1))), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2), co(cc, cpm, cdm(c1))))
  3impa(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0)), wcel(c2, cn0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2), co(cc, cpm, cdm(c1))))
  ffvelrnda(c2, cn0, co(c0, cdvn, c1), co(cc, cpm, cdm(c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0))))
  dvnff(c0, c1)
  sylancr(w3a(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0)), wcel(c2, cn0)), wb(wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2), co(cc, cpm, cdm(c1))), wa(wf(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2), cdm(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2)), cc), wss(cdm(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2)), cdm(c1)))), wcel(cc, universe), wcel(cdm(c1), universe))
  cnex()
  dmexd(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0), w3a(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0)), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  simp2(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0)), wcel(c2, cn0))
  elpm2g(cc, universe, cdm(c1), universe, cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2))
}

  ffvelrnda(c2, cn0, co(c0, cdvn, c1), co(cc, cpm, cdm(c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0))))
  dvnff(c0, c1)
  sylancr(w3a(wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)), wcel(c1, co(cc, cpm, c0)), wcel(c2, cn0)), wb(wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2), co(cc, cpm, cdm(c1))), wa(wf(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2), cdm(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2)), cc), wss(cdm(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, c1), c2)), cdm(c1)))), wcel(cc, universe), wcel(cdm(c1), universe))

thm cpnfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(ccpn, c0), cmpt(s0, cn0, crab(s1, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  sylbir(wss(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(ccpn, c0), cmpt(s0, cn0, crab(s1, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc))))), wcel(c0, cpw(cc)))
  elpw2(c0, cc)
  cnex()
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cpw(cc), ccpn, cmpt(s0, cn0, crab(s1, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc)))), cmpt(s0, cn0, crab(s1, co(cc, cpm, cv(hs0)), wcel(cfv(co(cv(hs0), cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc)))))
  mpteq2dv(s0, cn0, crab(s1, co(cc, cpm, cv(hs0)), wcel(cfv(co(cv(hs0), cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc))), crab(s1, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  rabeqbidv(s1, co(cc, cpm, cv(hs0)), co(cc, cpm, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cfv(co(cv(hs0), cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc)), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc)))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), c0, cc, cpm)
  eleq1d(cfv(co(cv(hs0), cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc), cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq1d(co(cv(hs0), cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0), co(c0, cdvn, cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), c0, cdvn, cv(s1))
  df-cpn(hs0, s0, s1)
  mptex(s0, cn0, crab(s1, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc))))
  nn0ex()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(cc))
  diff.hs0.c(cmpt(s0, cn0, crab(s1, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(s1)), cv(s0)), co(cdm(cv(s1)), ccncf, cc)))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.co.s(s1, cc, cpm, cv(hs0))
  diff.co.s(s1, cc, cpm, c0)
  diff.cc.s(s1)
  diff.cpm.s(s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
}

  fveq1d((hs0[Dn]s1), s0, (c0[Dn]s1), hs0 = c0)
  oveq1(hs0, c0, cdvn, s1)
  df-cpn(hs0, s0, s1)
  mptex(s0, cn0, { s1 ‚àà(‚ÑÇ[p‚Ü¶]c0)|((c0[Dn]s1)` s0)‚àà(dom(s1)[-cn->]‚ÑÇ)})
  nn0ex()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(P(‚ÑÇ))
  diff.hs0.c((s0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà(‚ÑÇ[p‚Ü¶]c0)|((c0[Dn]s1)` s0)‚àà(dom(s1)[-cn->]‚ÑÇ)}))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)

thm fncpn(class c0) {

} = {
  mpbiri(wss(c0, cc), wfn(cfv(ccpn, c0), cn0), wfn(cmpt(hs0, cn0, crab(hs1, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), co(cdm(cv(hs1)), ccncf, cc)))), cn0))

  rabex(hs1, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), co(cdm(cv(hs1)), ccncf, cc)))
  ovex(cc, cpm, c0)

  fneq1d(cfv(ccpn, c0), cn0, cmpt(hs0, cn0, crab(hs1, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), co(cdm(cv(hs1)), ccncf, cc)))), wss(c0, cc))
  cpnfval(hs0, hs1, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cn0)
  diff.hs1.c(co(cc, cpm, c0))

  fveq1d(cfv(ccpn, c0), c1, cmpt(hs1, cn0, crab(hs0, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)), co(cdm(cv(hs0)), ccncf, cc)))), wss(c0, cc))
  cpnfval(hs1, hs0, c0)
  fvmpt(hs1, c1, cn0, cmpt(hs1, cn0, crab(hs0, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)), co(cdm(cv(hs0)), ccncf, cc)))), crab(hs0, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(hs0)), c1), co(cdm(cv(hs0)), ccncf, cc))), crab(hs0, co(cc, cpm, c0), wcel(cfv(co(c0, cdvn, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)), co(cdm(cv(hs0)), ccncf, cc))))

  ovex(cc, cpm, c0)

blocks.name: cpnord
blocks.content: ` C^n ` conditions are ordered by strength. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 16-Nov-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: dvaddbr
blocks.content: The sum rule for derivatives at a point. For the (simpler but more limited) function version, see ~ dvadd . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: dvmulbr
blocks.content: The product rule for derivatives at a point. For the (simpler but more limited) function version, see ~ dvmul . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: dvadd
blocks.content: The sum rule for derivatives at a point. For the (more general) relation version, see ~ dvaddbr . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm dvadd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(co(c0, cdv, co(c1, cof(caddc), c2)), c3), co(cfv(co(c0, cdv, c1), c3), caddc, cfv(co(c0, cdv, c2), c3))))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c4, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c4, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c5, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c5, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cpr(cr, cc)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cdm(co(c0, cdv, c1))))

blocks.name: dvaddf
blocks.content: The sum rule for everywhere-differentiable functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2015.)

thm dvaddf(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wceq(cdm(co(c0, cdv, c2)), c3))
} = {
  eqcomd(co(c0, cdv, co(c1, cof(caddc), c2)), co(co(c0, cdv, c1), cof(caddc), co(c0, cdv, c2)), w0)

  dvbss(c0, co(c1, cof(caddc), c2), c3, w0)

  inidm(c3)
  syl(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(co(c0, cdv, co(c1, cof(caddc), c2)))), wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, cdv, co(c1, cof(caddc), c2)), co(cfv(co(c0, cdv, c1), cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(co(c0, cdv, c2), cv(hs0)))))
  dvaddbr(cv(hs0), c0, c1, c2, cfv(co(c0, cdv, c1), cv(hs0)), cfv(co(c0, cdv, c2), cv(hs0)), c3, c3, universe, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))

  fvexd(co(c0, cdv, c2), cv(hs0), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  mpbid(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wbr(cv(hs0), co(c0, cdv, c1), cfv(co(c0, cdv, c1), cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(co(c0, cdv, c1))))

  eqid(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))

  reldv(c0, co(c1, cof(caddc), c2))
  eqidd(cfv(co(c0, cdv, c1), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  eqidd(cfv(co(c0, cdv, c2), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  eqcomd(co(cfv(co(c0, cdv, c1), cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(co(c0, cdv, c2), cv(hs0))), cfv(co(c0, cdv, co(c1, cof(caddc), c2)), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))

blocks.name: dvcobr
blocks.content: The chain rule for derivatives at a point. For the (simpler but more limited) function version, see ~ dvco . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: dvcjbr
blocks.content: The derivative of the conjugate of a function. For the (simpler but more limited) function version, see ~ dvcj . (This doesn't follow from ~ dvcobr because ` * ` is not a function on the reals, and even if we used complex derivatives, ` * ` is not complex-differentiable.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Sep-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2015.)

  ‚ä¢ ((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0)‚Üí c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà { ‚Ñù, ‚ÑÇ })

  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0)‚Üí c1 ‚àà c4)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3))=(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0)‚Üí c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), ((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0)‚Üí c3 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ))

  a1ii(((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0)‚Üí c1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ), d(s0, c4))

  mpbid(w0, ((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3)): c0 ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ), ((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3)): dom((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3)))‚Üí ‚ÑÇ))
  syl(w0, ((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3)): dom((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3)))‚Üí ‚ÑÇ), c2 ‚àà { ‚Ñù, ‚ÑÇ })
  dvfg(c2, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3))
  feq2d((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3)), dom((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3))), cc, c0, w0)
  eqtrd(dom((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3))), c0, dom((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1)), w0)
  dmeqd((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3)), (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1), w0)
  syl(w0, dom((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))= c0, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà c4))
  ralrimiva(s0, c0, w0, c1 ‚àà c4)
  dmmptg(s0, c0, c1, c4)
  feq1d((c2[_D](s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c3)), c0, cc, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1), w0)
  diff.cc.s(s0)
}

  syl6eqelr(c1, universe, cdm(co(c0, cdv, cmpt(s0, c1, c3))), w0)

  eqtrd(dom((c0[_D](s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ c2))), c1, dom((s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ c4)), w0)
  dmeqd((c0[_D](s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ c2)), (s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ c4), w0)
  syl(w0, dom((s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ c4))= c1, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, c4 ‚àà c6))

  oveq2d(c0, cdv, ((s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ c2)[oF(+)](s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ c3)), (s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(c2[+]c3)), w0)

blocks.name: dvcnv
blocks.content: A weak version of ~ dvcnvre , valid for both real and complex domains but under the hypothesis that the inverse function is already known to be continuous, and the image set is known to be open. A more advanced proof can show that these conditions are unnecessary. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: dveflem
blocks.content: Derivative of the exponential function at 0. The key step in the proof is ~ eftlub , to show that ` abs ( exp ( x ) - 1 - x ) <_ abs ( x ) ^ 2 x. ( 3 / 4 ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: dvef
blocks.content: Derivative of the exponential function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2015.)

  |- wceq(co(cc, cdv, ce), ce)

  mpsyl(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wceq(cfv(co(cc, cdv, ce), cv(hs0)), cfv(ce, cv(hs0))), wfun(co(cc, cdv, ce)), wbr(cv(hs0), co(cc, cdv, ce), cfv(ce, cv(hs0))))

  dvfcn(ce)

blocks.content: Derivative of the sine and cosine functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-May-2016.)
